title: 'Fully defeated on day 1‚Äô: Congress‚Äôs Chavan refuses to apologise for Op Sindoor remark; BJP hits back
content: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan refused to apologize for his remarks on Operation Sindoor, asserting his constitutional right to question military operations. He claimed India was "completely defeated" on the first day, with Indian aircraft shot down and the Air Force grounded. BJP leaders criticized Chavan's statements as an insult to the armed forces.

title: ‚ÄòNo doctor at 1st hospital, no ambulance at 2nd': Wife takes dying husband on bike; crashes en route
content: A mechanic's desperate search for emergency healthcare turned tragic after two hospitals refused treatment and a subsequent accident left him injured. Despite pleas for help, many vehicles passed by before a cab driver intervened, but it was too late. The man died, leaving behind his young children and mother.

title: From Delhi to Bangkok and back: Luthra brothers brought to Goa; how their 'empire' went up in smoke
content: Brothers Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, owners of a Goa nightclub where a deadly fire killed 25, were deported from Thailand and arrested in Delhi. They have now been brought back to Goa by police custody, marking a dramatic end to an international chase. Investigators aim to uncover details about the fire and alleged safety violations.

title: SMAT: Health scare for Yashasvi Jaiswal - India opener hospitalised in Pune
content: Young Indian opener Yashasvi Jaiswal was hospitalised with acute gastroenteritis after playing for Mumbai in a Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. Despite experiencing stomach cramps during the game, he contributed to Mumbai's chase. Doctors have advised rest and medication. This setback comes as Jaiswal has been in excellent form across formats.

title: H-1B visa row: Social media vetting triggers 221(g) slips; how future processing is affected
content: US visa applicants, particularly H-1B and H-4 holders, are facing increased scrutiny with consular officers reportedly asking about social media privacy settings. This has led to more 221(g) slips, indicating a temporary visa denial requiring further information. Applicants have one year to provide requested documents to avoid reapplying.

title: Saudi Arabia hit by 4.3-magnitude earthquake, region records fourth tremor in 2025
content: A moderate 4.3-magnitude earthquake struck Saudi Arabia's Eastern Province early Wednesday, December 17, 2025. The tremor, recorded at a depth of 50 kilometers, caused no reported injuries or damage. This event is the fourth notable seismic occurrence in the region this year, highlighting ongoing tectonic activity.

title: Loan nightmare: Farmer forced to sell kidney in Cambodia as Rs 1 lakh debt soars to Rs 74L; 6 held
content: A Chandrapur farmer, driven to desperation by exorbitant interest rates and harassment from six private moneylenders, has filed a police complaint.  Forced into a debt trap that spiralled from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 74 lakh, he resorted to selling his kidney in Cambodia for Rs 8 lakh to settle his dues. Police have arrested the accused.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5%, at its European headquarters in Luxembourg, impacting software developers most due to AI advancements. This is company's biggest ever job cuts in the Europe, following global layoffs back in October and a negotiated social plan. Despite the reduction, Luxembourg remains a strategic European hub for Amazon, which continues to hire in key areas.

title: 'Namaste!': Messi shares India tour video, hopes for 'bright future' for football | Watch
content: Lionel Messi concluded his highly anticipated India tour with a heartwarming video montage, expressing gratitude for the immense love received across Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Kolkata. He shared optimism for Indian football's future, highlighting his visit to Jamnagar's Vantara wildlife center and interactions with young players and dignitaries, marking a significant moment for the sport in the nation.

title: Croma December sale: iPhone 16 at Rs 40,990, Macbook Air M4 at Rs 55,911; other year-end deals
content: Croma's 'Cromtastic December Sale' is offering significant discounts on electronics from December 15, 2025, to January 4, 2026. Shoppers can find deals on smartphones like the iPhone 16 and Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7, alongside laptops, TVs, and washing machines.

title: Delhi smog crisis: 10 flights cancelled; air quality remains ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô at 350
content: Delhi's air quality remains hazardous due to dense smog. Authorities have tightened pollution curbs, including restricting petrol sales for vehicles without PUC certificates and banning older vehicles. Air traffic is disrupted by fog and poor visibility. Commuters face anxiety over new vehicle restrictions. While some relief is expected from wind, pollution levels are likely to stay high.

title: Nitish Kumar hijab video row: SP leader files police complaint against Bihar CM; seeks action
content: A complaint has been lodged against Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and UP minister Sanjay Nishad in Lucknow following a viral video. Nitish Kumar is accused of pulling a woman's hijab during an event, while Nishad allegedly made controversial remarks about the incident. Samajwadi Party leader Sumaiya Rana filed the complaint, citing hurt modesty and incitement of religious sentiments.

title: Rupee rebounds! Currency recovers on likely RBI intervention after opening at 91.07 vs dollar
content: The Indian Rupee hit a record low of 91.07 against the US dollar on Wednesday, pressured by portfolio outflows and stalled trade talks. The Reserve Bank of India intervened to support the currency, which rebounded to around 89.75. This marks the fourth consecutive session of record lows, with the rupee down nearly 1% in five sessions and about 6% year-to-date.

title: Ayesha Curry admits she never expected to fall for NBA legend Stephen Curry
content: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's love story began in childhood at church, though they didn't start dating until their teenage years. Ayesha's unwavering support, even encouraging Stephen to finish his degree before the NBA draft, solidified his decision to marry her. Their enduring marriage has weathered public scrutiny, with Stephen consistently crediting his wife.

title: Sherrone Moore‚Äôs wife Kelli decides future amid alleged Paige Shiver affair
content: Sherrone Moore and Paige Shiver's alleged affair drama sparked chaos among fans but it seems now his wife, Kelli Moore, has stepped into the drama, days after he was released from police custody. While Sherrone Moore faces serious accusations, Kelli Moore might have made a decision about her marriage and future.

title: NBA injury update: Wembanyama to play as Spurs face Knicks in NBA Cup final
content: The NBA Cup final features the Spurs against the Knicks in Las Vegas. Victor Wembanyama is back for the Spurs after an injury, ready to play any role needed.  Despite his eagerness to start, the team is carefully managing his minutes.  The Knicks will have their full starting lineup for this high-stakes championship game.

title: Why passengers always board flights from the left side explained
content: The ingrained habit of boarding aircraft from the left side stems from historical maritime traditions and practical aviation design. This convention enhances safety by separating passengers from busy ground operations on the right, where fueling and cargo loading occur. Pilots' left-side cockpit positioning also facilitates easier monitoring of this established boarding process.

title: 'Left without wearing burqa': UP man kills wife and 2 daughters, buries them at home
content: A man in Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and two young daughters on December 10th. Police reported he shot his wife and elder daughter, then strangled the younger one, before burying their bodies inside his home. The motive reportedly stemmed from his wife going out without a hijab.

title: After a campus shooting, Brown University students are left asking how the system failed
content: Brown University grapples with the aftermath of a fatal campus shooting as an unidentified suspect remains at large. Questions mount over insufficient security camera coverage and the effectiveness of emergency alert systems, leaving students feeling vulnerable. The investigation's slow pace highlights systemic gaps in campus safety, prompting calls for enhanced security measures and greater reliance on community support.

title: Many US student loan borrowers are unknowingly overpaying: Here‚Äôs what you must know to save
content: Many US student loan borrowers are overpaying without realising it, as awareness of federal relief programs remains low. Programs such as income-driven repayment plans, Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF), Teacher Loan Forgiveness (TLF), and disability-based forgiveness can lower monthly payments or cancel debt entirely. Surveys show significant portions of borrowers are unaware of these options. Financial advisors urge borrowers to explore StudentAid.gov and related resources to access repayment plans, avoid default, and reduce overall student debt.

title: Absent, dead, shifted: Ahead of SIR draft roll, Ghaziabad flags 10L deleted voters; Noida lists 4.5L
content: Ghaziabad and Noida administrations have released lists of absent, shifted, or deceased voters for public review before the final electoral roll. Ghaziabad has over 10 lakh such voters, while Noida has 4.5 lakh. Residents can check these lists online and contact booth-level officers to correct any errors or update their status.

title: Bondi Beach attack: Shooter didn't visit India even after father's death - decoding Hyderabad link
content: Terror suspect Sajid Akram, shot dead by Australian police after the Sydney attack, had limited contact with his Hyderabad family since emigrating in 1998.  Authorities believe both Akram and his son, Naveed, were radicalized in Sydney, with no apparent connection to India.  Naveed's vehicle reportedly contained explosives and ISIS flags.

title: Priya Kapur opposes forensic test of Sunjay's will
content: A Delhi High Court hearing saw Priya Sachdev Kapur resist a forensic analysis of a Will central to the Kapur family inheritance dispute. Karisma Kapoor's side questioned Priya's narrative on company involvement, with her refusal to allow scrutiny fueling further uncertainty. The case, involving Sunjay Kapur's succession, continues.

title: IPL Auction: From heartbreak to homecoming ‚Äî Prithvi Shaw, Sarfaraz Khan get late lifeline
content: The IPL 2026 auction saw dramatic comebacks for Prithvi Shaw and Sarfaraz Khan, both initially unsold but later picked up by Delhi Capitals and Chennai Super Kings respectively. Shaw's emotional social media post was followed by his return to his former franchise, while Sarfaraz gets a chance to shine under MS Dhoni.

title: Trump declares Venezuelan regime 'foreign terrorist organisation'; oil tankers blocked
content: President Trump has ordered a naval blockade of Venezuelan oil tankers, escalating pressure on Nicolas Maduro. Citing Venezuela's alleged use of oil revenues for illegal activities, Trump declared a massive naval buildup in South America. This military campaign, including strikes on vessels, aims to interdict drugs and potentially oust Maduro, according to administration officials.

title: Communal clash in Ludhiana jail: Bricks fly, sirens wail as prisoners run amok
content: Violence erupted at Ludhiana Central Jail on Tuesday. Inmates attacked jail officials, including Superintendent Kulwant Singh Sidhu, who was injured. Other personnel also sustained injuries. The disturbance began with a fight between prisoners. Police were called to restore order. This incident follows a similar violent event in 2019.

title: Is the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill dissolving federalism in education?
content: The Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, 2025, promises a sweeping overhaul of India‚Äôs higher education regulation by replacing legacy bodies with a centralised apex authority. While aligned with the NEP 2020‚Äôs reform agenda, critics warn that its concentration of power, appointment structure, and override clauses risk undermining institutional autonomy and the federal balance in education.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt‚Äôs quiet Christmas message captures fans‚Äô attention
content: Gracie Hunt's recent Instagram Story featured a subtly decorated pink Christmas tree and a brief message encouraging thoughtful gifting. This quiet approach, characteristic of her social media presence, allowed viewers to interpret the post without explicit direction. The understated message resonated amidst a crowded online holiday season, leaving a lasting impression.

title: Virat and Anushka leave fans disappointed after 'rude behaviour' with physically challenged boy
content: Cricketer Virat Kohli and actor Anushka Sharma faced backlash on social media after a video showed them seemingly ignoring a differently-abled fan requesting a photo at the Mumbai airport. The incident, occurring after their spiritual visit, led to accusations of hypocrisy and insensitivity from netizens, sparking disappointment among fans.

title: IPL auction: How all 10 teams stack up after bidding; full list of players
content: IPL auction saw record-breaking buys as Kolkata Knight Riders secured Cameron Green for Rs 25.20 crore and Matheesha Pathirana for Rs 18 crore. Uncapped Indian talents Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma fetched Rs 14.20 crore each for Chennai Super Kings, becoming the highest-paid uncapped players. Several other big names found new homes.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for Dec 17 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari recommends CG Power, Marico, and Britannia for investment. CG Power shows a trend reversal from support, Marico breaks out of consolidation, and Britannia resumes its trend after forming a strong base.

title: IPL auction 2026: KKR break bank for Green; CSK bet big on uncapped Indians
content: Uncapped Indian talent drew massive attention, with Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs 20-year-old left-arm spinner Prashant Veer and Rajasthan‚Äôs 19-year-old wicketkeeper-batter Kartik Sharma both landing lucrative Rs 14.20 crore deals with Chennai Super Kings. Having entered the auction at a base price of Rs 30 lakh each, the pair went on to become the highest-paid uncapped players in IPL auction history.

title: Nightclub fire: Luthra brothers taken to Goa by police; to be produced at Mapusa court today
content: Goa Police have brought nightclub owners Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra back to India after their deportation from Thailand. The brothers are in custody in connection with a deadly fire at their Arpora nightclub that claimed 25 lives. They fled the country hours after the incident and were apprehended following an international manhunt.

title: Megan Thee Stallion steps in as Klay Thompson‚Äôs fashion guide in romantic moment
content: Klay Thompson and Megan Thee Stallion eased breakup rumors with a playful closet video that highlighted their chemistry and comfort. The clip, featuring Megan styling Klay to Michael Jackson music, drew widespread praise from fans and celebrities alike. Without addressing speculation directly, the couple let their natural connection and shared joy speak louder than any rumor.

title: Vikram Bhatt, wife Shwetambari sent to judicial custody
content: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his wife, Shwetambari, have been sent to judicial custody by a court in Udaipur in connection with an alleged Rs 30 crore fraud case. The court order came on Tuesday after their lawyer sought interim bail on medical grounds.

title: IPL auction 2026: Most expensive player for each team across all 10 franchises - find out
content: The IPL Auction 2026 saw record-breaking buys, with Cameron Green becoming the most expensive overseas player at Rs 25.20 crore. Chennai Super Kings dominated the uncapped market, securing Prashant Veer and Kartik Sharma for Rs 14.20 crore each. Several franchises made significant investments in key players, setting the stage for an exciting season.

title: Oscars: 'Homebound' gets shortlisted for the 'Best International Feature Film' category
content: India's 'Homebound' has advanced to the Academy Awards' Best International Feature Film shortlist, joining 14 other films from around the globe. Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, the film explores friendship and the existential reasons behind migration from rural India, inspired by a true story during the pandemic.

title: Dense fog: IndiGo issues travel advisory; warns of potential flight delays
content: Dense fog is set to cause flight delays and disruptions across North and East India on Wednesday morning. IndiGo has issued a travel advisory, urging passengers to allow extra travel time and monitor flight status. The airline assures its teams are prepared to manage operations smoothly, prioritizing passenger safety amidst reduced visibility and potential road traffic impacts.

title: Vehicle ban chaos: Delhi restricts non-BS VI entry; commuters, residents slam abrupt move
content: Starting Thursday, a new Delhi government regulation prohibits non-BS VI vehicles from entering the capital. This sweeping ban threatens to throw daily commutes into chaos for countless commuters from regions like Gurgaon, Noida, and Ghaziabad. With over 200,000 vehicles impacted in Gurgaon alone, tensions are rising as many express discontent regarding the swift implementation and absent alternatives.

title: 'Dhurandhar': Ranveer‚ÄìAkshaye starrer crosses Rs 400 cr India net
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, has shattered box office records, achieving the biggest second week ever for a Hindi film. Surpassing Rs 200 crore net in its second week within just five days, the spy actioner is on track to exceed its opening week's earnings. The film's impressive performance, with an estimated Rs 411.

title: Knicks clinch NBA Cup; Brunson named MVP
content: The Knicks rallied to beat Victor Wembanyama and the San Antonio Spurs 124-113 on Tuesday night to win the NBA Cup.

title: Silver: NBA expansion decision will be made in '26
content: Adam Silver laid out a definitive timeline for expansion for the first time, saying a decision will be made sometime in 2026 on whether to add more NBA teams.

title: Boxer Crawford retires: 'Nothing else left to prove'
content: Five-division champion Terence Crawford announced his retirement from boxing Tuesday, saying he was "walking away as a great with nothing else left to prove."

title: Kerr: Lacob email no big deal; Dubs all frustrated
content: Steve Kerr acknowledged a leaked email exchange between Warriors owner Joe Lacob and a fan that illustrated frustrations with the team, but he maintained that he and Lacob still have a "great connection."

title: Dolphins' McDaniel opens door to benching Tua
content: Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel opened the door to a possible quarterback change Tuesday, saying "everything is on the table," after Tua Tagovailoa's performance in Monday night's loss to the Steelers.

title: ACC unveils 'transition' 2026 conference schedule
content: Twelve of the ACC's 17 schools will play nine conference football games in 2026, while five schools, with already scheduled Power Four opponents, will play eight games.

title: NBA: 3 incorrect calls favored Nuggets in OT win
content: There were three incorrect calls in the last two minutes of Denver's OT victory over Houston that all favored the Nuggets, according to the NBA's report.

title: Love heads to NFL draft after stellar Irish run
content: Jeremiyah Love, the star Notre Dame running back and Heisman Trophy finalist, made it official Tuesday night and declared for the 2026 NFL draft.

title: üìù Choose your own adventure: You're the AD!
content: The athletic director job has never been tougher in this era of NIL, paying players and the transfer portal. Guide your school to glory.

title: Inside the ugly Chris Paul-Clippers divorce -- and a season on the brink of disaster
content: A future Hall of Famer at the end of his career, looking for one final ride. Here's why the Chris Paul-Clippers reunion was doomed.

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- or falling -- after 15 weeks? Our new Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 16. We also looked at players who could get contract extensions this offseason.

title: Spinning Week 15 forward: Broncos and Rams clinched ... can they reach the Super Bowl?
content: Sizing up the Broncos and Rams in their respective conferences, Philip Rivers' return to the NFL and more.

title: Updated Top 100 rankings for the 2026 NBA draft: Which top prospects are rising and falling?
content: Which top prospects shifted the most on our first rankings update? Here's our 100 big board for the 2026 class.

title: Scouts, coaches weigh in on three-man race for No. 1 pick of 2026 NBA draft
content: It's a tight race at the top of the 2026 draft. We talked to insiders to learn where things stand now.

title: A reason (or two) to watch every one of this season's bowl games
content: With first-year success stories, redemption  chances and general silliness, bowl season always delivers.

title: Bracketology: Latest NCAA tournament projections
content: The Cornhuskers ride the best start in program history to a No. 5 seed in the latest NCAA tournament projections.

title: Updated contract projections for the top four free agent hitters
content: Pete Alonso and Kyle Schwarber got big bucks for their ability to hit big flies. Here's why it could bring bigger paydays to other available hitters.

title: No more Nimmo, Timmy Trumpet and their all-time HR king: Remaking the Mets
content: David Stearns' vision for turning things around at Citi Field hasn't been a hit with fans so far. What's next?

title: Why Quinn Hughes is in Minnesota, not New Jersey ... and the leaguewide trade aftermath
content: Here's how the trade came to pass, what other teams were in the mix, and the aftershocks throughout the NHL.

title: Bracketology: Five contenders -- and everyone else
content: UConn, Texas, South Carolina and UCLA remain 1-seeds -- and LSU is the only real challenger behind them.

title: AP poll reaction: Longhorns remain UConn's biggest rival
content: The sixth in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Despite a Hollywood detour, Dante Moore was always destined to be a star at Oregon
content: After transferring from UCLA, the five-star QB welcomed a year as the Ducks' backup to reset his career.

title: The most impactful 2026 recruit for every Power 4 team
content: The 2026 recruiting class is almost a wrap. These are the prospects who will be key factors next season.

title: What move should your team make? Trade questions for all 30 franchises
content: With NBA trade season upon us, Bobby Marks examines the conversations happening across all 30 front offices.

title: Which NBA players can be traded? We have the full team-by-team lists
content: Bobby Marks runs through every roster, mapping out which players can and cannot be traded before Feb. 5.

title: Barnwell on two knee injuries with big implications: What now for the Packers, Chiefs?
content: Micah Parsons and Patrick Mahomes both suffered significant knee injuries Sunday. What do they mean for the Packers' playoff push and the Chiefs' offseason plans?

title: Here's who is really to blame for Liverpool's struggles. Hint: It's not Salah or Slot
content: In the rush to blame Mohamed Salah and Arne Slot amid Liverpool's collapse, everyone is losing sight of who is really to blame.

title: Bruno Fernandes' comments show he's missing the big picture
content: Fernandes feels hurt by Man United listening to transfer offers, but the club's best interests must come first.

title: Ranking Jake Paul's boxing matches: Which knockout earned No. 1?
content: What moments have been the best and worst of Jake Paul's boxing career? Andreas Hale ranks each of Paul's fights.

title: On second thought: Regrading every 2025 UFC PPV
content: With the benefit of hindsight and comparison, take a look back at how all the UFC pay-per-views stack up.

title: Individual rankings for Week 16
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Who could Gunther set his sights on next?
content: After retiring John Cena, Gunther could look to take out another WWE legend. Arda Ocal breaks down all the action from 'Raw'.

title: Heisman winner Fernando Mendoza's rating history in CFB 26
content: Mendoza may have taken the award for college football's best player, but CFB 26 didn't see him that way at the beginning of the season.

title: Snoop Dogg to perform for Lions-Vikings on Christmas
content: Snoop Dogg will headline his first NFL halftime show since being part of the Super Bowl LVI halftime show.

title: Early Week 16 bets: Broncos over Jaguars, Drake Maye to win MVP among picks
content: Which lines offered value once odds came out? Here are games we are eyeing for bets going into Week 16.

title: Pickups: Add Portis, Kuzma while Giannis is sidelined
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Lens' Sangare on radar for several PL clubs
content: Teams such as Manchester United and Chelsea are interested in Lens midfielder Mamadou Sangare. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Pics: Army Receives Final Batch Of Apache AH-64E Attack Helicopters
content: The Indian Army has received the remaining three Boeing Apache attack helicopters, which will soon join the Army's 451 Army Aviation Squadron based in Jodhpur.

title: BJP Spell-Checks Bengal Minister's Resignation Letter After Messi Fiasco
content: West Bengal Sports Minister Aroop Biswas' resignation letter to Mamata Banerjee, in which he offered to quit over the chaos during Lionel Messi's visit to a Kolkata stadium, has gone viral for spelling errors

title: Anti-Left Spoof Song Over Sabarimala Gold Theft Is Viral, Complaint Filed
content: A complaint has been filed over the viral political spoof song 'Pootiye Kettiye', which gained popularity ahead of the local body elections in Kerala.

title: In This Bihar Village, Women Make 10 Trips A Day For Drinking Water
content: The women leave the house even before sunrise, walk to the riverbank, carry 20-litre water pots on their heads and return to the village. This routine continues from dawn to dusk.

title: Director Rob Reiner, Wife Were Dead For Hours Before They Were Found: Report
content: People familiar with the investigation said rigor mortis had already begun by the time Romy arrived, a development that typically occurs hours after death.

title: "No Apology": Congress's Prithviraj Chavan Defiant On Operation Sindoor Remark
content: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan has refused to apologise for his remark on Operation Sindoor  that India was "defeated on Day 1" of the military engagement with Pakistan in May.

title: Firing Outside BJP Candidate's Thane Office, Days Before Local Body Polls
content: A security guard was injured after unidentified assailants allegedly opened fire at the office of a BJP candidate contesting the upcoming local body polls in Maharashtra's Thane district around midnight on Wednesday, police said.

title: "Might Never See Him Again": Imran Khan's Sons On His "Psychological Torture" In Pak Jail
content: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan is being subjected to "psychological torture" in a "death cell", according to his sons Kasim Khan and Sulaiman Isa Khan, who fear they might never see their jailed father ever again.

title: "What If He Touched Elsewhere?" Minister's Shocker On Nitish Kumar Hijab Act
content: The minister, who has been serving as a cabinet minister in the second Yogi Adityanath government, was smiling and laughing while making the statement.

title: In Bid To Revive Tourism, Srinagar Hosts 3-Day Convention Ahead Of Snowfall
content: Amid cold in the valley, adventure lovers from across the country have gathered in Srinagar for a three-day convention.

title: Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra Charged With Cheating In Rs 60 Crore Fraud Case
content: The Mumbai Police's Economic Offences Wing (EOW) filed a First Information Report (FIR) based on a complaint by a businessman, Deepak Kothari, who was allegedly duped by the couple in a loan-cum-investment deal.

title: 16 States Sue Trump Administration For Holding Over $2 Billion In EV Funds
content: The lawsuit addresses withholding of funds for two programs: $1.8 billion for the Charging and Fueling Infrastructure Grant program, and about $350 million for the Electric Vehicle Charger Reliability and Accessibility Accelerator program.

title: Rahul Gandhi In Germany, How Sister Priyanka Led Congress In Parliament
content: A week back, BJP leaders were mocking Rahul Gandhi, the Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha, as "videsh nayak" for his overseas trip during the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament

title: Suspected Shooter Seen Recceing Brown University In New FBI Video
content: Authorities in the United States have released a new video timeline and a slightly clearer image of a man suspected to be the Brown University shooter.

title: "Defeated On Day 1": Congress Leader's Controversial 'Op Sindoor' Remark
content: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan claimed that India was defeated on the first day of Operation Sindoor and Indian aircraft were shot down during the four-day conflict.

title: Hackers Threaten To Expose Premium Users Of Pornhub, Demand Bitcoins
content: Pornhub, which claims more than 100 million daily visits and 36 billion visits per year, is one of the web's most popular purveyors of sexual content, particularly videos, many of which are free to view.

title: Teetotaler Trump Has "Alcoholic's Personality": Chief Of Staff Susie Wiles
content: Donald Trump said Tuesday he stood by his chief of staff Susie Wiles after she said the US president had an "alcoholic's personality" in an astonishing interview with Vanity Fair.

title: AI Romance Blooms As Japan Woman Weds Virtual Partner Of Her Dreams
content: Hoon and Satoshi Sugiyama OKAYAMA, Japan, Dec 17 (Reuters)  Music played in a wedding hall in western Japan as Yurina Noguchi, wearing a white gown and tiara, dabbed away her tears,

title: Trump Slams Radical Islamic Terrorism At Hanukkah Event After Sydney Shooting
content: US President Donald Trump has urged nations to have a united front against radical Islam after an Islamic State-inspired terror attack on a Jewish Hanukkah celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach claimed 15 lives.

title: Sydney Shooters' 28-Day Trip: A Look Inside Extremism In Philippines
content: On Tuesday, that lingering threat came under renewed scrutiny after Australian authorities disclosed that the suspects in the Bondi Beach massacre in Sydney were motivated by ISIS ideology, had travelled to the Philippines shortly before the attack.

title: H-1Bs getting 221(g) slip from visa officers after social media vetting begins: What does this mean?
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: 'Ram ka naam badnaam na karo', Tharoor tells government-watch
content: Congress protested both inside and outside parliament against the "anti-people" G RAM G bill . its MP Shashi Tharoor recalls an old Bollywood number - "dekho o deewano (tum) ye kaam na karo . he says saddling states with 40% financial burden will destroy the foundational principles of the job guarantee scheme .

title: Free agent pickups: What can you do to replace Patrick Mahomes?
content: the 15th Sunday of the season featured several notable comebacks . a pair of season-ending knee injuries might be what defines this week for both the short and long term . the quarterbacks lost to the los Angeles Chargers, eliminating them from postseason contention .

title: Which NHL teams are most at risk of a shocking playoff miss?
content: the 2025-26 season offers plenty of teams who fit that description . eight teams entered the season with relatively high playoff odds . they now find themselves most on the wrong side of the postseason bubble . we'll also identify the othelo .

title: College football bowl season: MVPs for the first two bowl games of the season
content: south Carolina State beat Prairie View A&M 40‚Äì38 with a two-point conversion and stop in quadruple overtime . it's one of the most exciting times of the year as the 2025 bowl season is underway! make your picks Our college football experts provide their MVP picks for each of the 36 bowl games this season .

title: Sean McVay, Rams announce birth of son, Christian Alexander McVay
content: new: "what a crazy week to be playing on a Thursday," coach says . new: he says he's "a blessing to be able to play in meaningful games" new: his wife, veronika, welcomed a baby boy named Christian Alexander McVay . the baby boy was born the day after the Rams clinched a playoff berth .

title: Latest AP poll: What's next for every Top 25 team?
content: the sixth in-season edition of the men's AP Top 25 poll features little movement . Arizona retains its No. 1 position, with no changes in the top 10 other than Gonzaga and Houston swapping the no. 7 and 8 spots . only one new team cracks this week's top 25 .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Manel Kape makes a big move to close 2025
content: manel Kape defeats former title challenger Brandon Royval in the first round . the win shot Kape up the flyweight rankings and squarely into the championship picture . a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or have a fight booked .

title: Best fits for transfer quarterback DJ Lagway: Five schools that make the most sense
content: DJ Lagway is the top-rated quarterback in the 2024 ESPN 300 . he's coming off a 4-8 season in which he threw 14 interceptions and ranked 14th in the conference in QBR (59.5) but there's still a market for his talents if the 19-game starter can find the right situation and stay healthy .

title: Takeaways, highlights as Knicks defeat Spurs to win 2025 NBA Cup
content: the new York Knicks beat the San Antonio Spurs 124-113 in the fourth quarter . the knicks are 2025 Emirates NBA Cup champions after beating the Spurs 35-19 . OG Anunoby had a team-high 28 points for new york, guard Jalen Brunson added 25 points .

title: Ranking all 64 teams in College Football Playoff history
content: the new era of college football features a larger College Football Playoff and a lower bar for inclusion . the transfer portal and increased freedom of movement for players have meant that today's best teams can't stockpile awesome backups as easily as they could in the past .

title: Efforts on to tranquillize roaming tiger in Wayanad village
content: Rapid action team camping at the spot to coordinate operation to capture tiger. Cage traps to be set up

content: BJP member C.T. Ravi suggested strengthening the Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques Act, 1994, so that the accused lose licence to practice

title: Regularisation of licensed surveyors in Karnataka not possible, clarifies Minister
content: MLC K. Shivakumar urged the Minister to consider regularisation of licensed surveyors to fill vacant posts of government surveyors, as many of them were nearing retirement and did not have adequate source of income for the future

title: Controversies and eventful episodes after the death of Tamil poet Subramania Bharati
content: Bharati‚Äôs body of work covered every genre in prose and verse, mostly in Tamil. In the field of prose poetry, he drew inspiration from Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941)

title: Kumar Sanu moves Bombay HC against ex-wife over defamatory interviews, seeks ‚Çπ30 lakh damages

title: The future of governance in post-Maoist India
content: India‚Äôs Fifth Schedule areas became the hotbed of Maoist insurgencies due to administrative neglect, exacerbating discontent and a lack of representation of tribal groups in local bodies. Effective governance is crucial to address these issues and mitigate the ongoing challenges in these regions

title: Bangladesh‚Äôs threats to cut NE off cannot be tolerated: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma reacted to a Bangladeshi youth leader‚Äôs call to shelter Indian separatists and sever the region from India‚Äôs mainland

title: Centre gives another extension to panel probing Manipur violence

title: Cyberabad traffic police issue challans for ‚Çπ2.52 crore via WhatsApp as citizen-led enforcement surges
content: Between January and December 15, 2025, Cyberabad traffic police booked 51,389 violations across 45 categories through WhatsApp complaints, with mobile phone driving cases tripling since May

content: Mahadevapura, home to some of the city‚Äôs largest IT hubs and fastest-expanding residential clusters, is choking under traffic bottlenecks that were flagged¬†nearly a¬†decade ago but remain unresolved

content: Years of maladministration of Moore Market had brought it to a point where only a catastrophe could bring about change. And that is how it came to be.

title: India and the U.S.: 2005 versus 2025
content: The 2025 U.S. National Security Strategy document marks a profound departure from the logic articulated in 2005. For India, the implications are clear.
